description: This course covers the basics of digital communications over computer and telephone networks. Introduction to communication architectures: services, protocols, and hierarchical layering, OSI and TCP/IP architectures. The physical layer of communications: physical media, signals, time and frequency, Fourier representations and bandwidth, capacity, modems, and data transmission schemes. The data link layer of communications: error detection and correction, data compression, ARQ protocols, synchronization and framing, HDLC protocol.
name: DATA COMMUNICATIONS
